title: 105_hr1948
content:
The Act titled "Hood Bay Land Exchange Act of 1997" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 outlines the findings of the Act. The Congress found that the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act established the Admiralty Island National Monument managed by the Forest Service. The Forest Service policy supports acquiring private land inholdings within the monument. The Greens Creek Land Exchange Act of 1996 facilitated a land exchange in the monument. Alaska Pulp Corporation's 54 acres in Hood Bay on Admiralty Island are available for transfer to Federal ownership. The United States owns reversionary interests to 143.87 acres near Silver Bay in Alaska, which could be transferred to Alaska Pulp Corporation for future development. Additionally, the acquisition of Chaik Bay property on Admiralty Island for incorporation into the Kootznoowoo Wilderness is deemed to be in the public interest. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, key definitions include:
- ANILCA: Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act
- Company: Alaska Pulp Corporation
- Company Property: Land depicted on United States Survey Plat 1058
- Federal Property: Reversionary interest of the United States described in a specific patent, excluding certain interests. The curr_chunk provides definitions for key terms related to the Admiralty Island National Monument, managed by the Secretary of Agriculture, the city and borough of Sitka, Alaska, and the Sitka Property consisting of approximately 49 acres of land. The curr_chunk discusses land exchange, transfer, and relinquishment. The curr_chunk outlines the exchange and transfer of Company and Federal Property, with the Company conveying its rights to the United States and receiving a quitclaim deed in return. Additionally, upon relinquishing the Federal Property, the Company must transfer its rights in the Sitka Property to Sitka. The availability of maps depicting the properties is also mentioned. The maps depicting Company Property and Federal Property will be available for public inspection in the Office of the Forest Supervisor, Chatham Area, Tongass National Forest, Sitka, Alaska. The maps showing Sitka Property will be available in the Office of the Manager of Sitka, Alaska, until the conveyance, after which they will be recorded with the deed. SEC. 5. PROCESSING OF AND TERMS AND CONDITIONS RELATING TO LAND EXCHANGE. The Secretary of the Interior may conduct surveys for the exchange, with costs borne by the Company. The Federal Property and Company Property are considered of equal value. The Secretary is responsible for implementing the rights and obligations of the United States. The Company's cleanup obligations remain unchanged under existing agreements and laws. The covenants, including restrictive covenants recorded on September 4, 1997, must be acceptable to the Secretary for the conveyance of Company Property to the United States. Upon acquisition, Company Property will be managed as part of Admiralty Island National Monument and Kootznoowoo Wilderness. The Secretary is authorized to negotiate for the acquisition of private property in Chaik Bay on Admiralty Island. This can be done through an option to purchase or exchange agreement, either through existing mechanisms or subsequent ratification by Congress. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
